What's the Catch with Free Plans?

Free tiers are for testing, not business use.

All AI website builders offer free trials or free tiers to get you started. But they all have limitations designed to encourage upgrading. Common limitations: subdomain branding (looks unprofessional), storage caps, feature restrictions, and branding/watermarks. Free tiers are perfect for testing and trying before you buy. For serious business use, you'll want a paid plan with custom domain and full features.

When to Upgrade to Paid

‚úì You need a custom domain

Free tiers use subdomains (yoursite.framer.website). Custom domains = professionalism and cost $10-20/year.

‚úì You need more features

E-commerce, advanced CMS, analytics, and premium features require paid plans.

‚úì You want to remove branding

Free plans include builder branding. Paid plans let you remove it for a professional look.

‚úì You need more storage/projects

Free tiers limit projects or storage. Paid plans offer unlimited or much higher limits.

Frequently Asked Questions

Which AI website builder is truly free with no credit card?

Framer offers the best free tier with no credit card required. You get 14 days of full Pro features, then a free tier forever. Durable also offers free trials but with more limitations. Most "free" plans require payment info upfront or are very limited.

Can I publish a website for free without paying?

Yes, Framer lets you publish free sites on a framer.website subdomain forever. Wix also offers free sites with wixsite.com subdomain. However, you'll want a custom domain eventually for professionalism, which requires payment.

What's the catch with free AI website builders?

Free tiers usually have limitations: subdomain branding (yoursite.framer.website), limited features, storage caps, or watermarks. Framer's free tier is generous but you'll hit limits on projects and need a paid plan for custom domain. Free tiers are for testing, not long-term business use.

How long can I use an AI website builder for free?

Framer offers a 14-day free trial of Pro features, then reverts to free tier. The free tier lasts forever but with limited projects. Wix and 10Web have limited free plans. Most AI builders offer 7-14 day free trials, then require payment.

Which free AI builder should I choose?

Start with Framer. It has the most generous free tier: 14-day Pro trial, then 2 free projects forever. Beautiful designs, no credit card required, and you can actually publish without paying. Test it thoroughly before deciding if you need to upgrade.

AI WEBSITE BUILDERS WITH FREE PLANS (NO CREDIT CARD REQUIRED)
Framer = 9/10 (Best Free Tier). Durable = 8/10 (Free Trial). Webflow = 7/10 (14 Days). No Credit Card = No Surprise Charges. Honest Guide.

Complete guide: 67% of "free trials" require credit card upfront. Learn which AI website builders offer truly free plans without payment information.

THE HONEST TRUTH ABOUT "FREE" TRIALS

üí° THE CREDIT CARD TRAP

Most "free trials" aren't actually free. They require credit card upfront, count on you forgetting to cancel, then charge you automatically when trial ends. This is the "free trial" trap - 67% of platforms do it. True free means: no credit card required, can actually use the platform, fair limitations (not crippled). This guide only covers platforms with TRULY free tiers or trials - no credit card needed.

‚úÖ TRULY FREE (No Credit Card)

  • ‚úÖ Framer: Free forever (1 site, Framer branding)
  • ‚úÖ Webflow: 14-day trial (no card required)
  • ‚úÖ Durable: Free trial (no card during trial period)
  • ‚úÖ Carrd: Free forever (limited, but functional)
  • ‚úÖ Google Sites: Free forever (very basic)

‚ùå "FREE" WITH CREDIT CARD TRAP

  • ‚ùå Squarespace: 14-day trial (requires card)
  • ‚ùå Wix: "Free" plan (requires card for any features)
  • ‚ùå Shopify: 3-day trial (requires card, extends to 90 if card provided)
  • ‚ùå Most others: Same trap - card upfront, "forget to cancel" revenue model

‚ö†Ô∏è WHY THIS MATTERS

43% of people forget to cancel free trials. Platforms know this - it's their revenue model. "Free trial" with credit card = "I hope you forget and I charge you $200." True free plans let you test risk-free. If platform is confident in product, they don't need your credit card to prove value. Choose platforms that earn your business through quality, not trickery.

PLATFORM-BY-PLATFORM BREAKDOWN

1. Framer - Best Free Tier (9/10)

Free tier: Free forever, no credit card required
Limitations: 1 site, Framer branding in footer, limited CMS (50 items)
What you get: Full access to all features, beautiful templates, AI generation
Upgrade trigger: Remove branding, custom domain, CMS expansion

üí° Pro tip: Framer's free tier is GENEROUS. You can build professional site, launch on .framer.site domain, upgrade only when you're ready for custom domain. No time pressure. Best free tier by far.

2. Webflow - 14-Day Free Trial (7/10)

Free trial: 14 days, no credit card required
Limitations: Time-limited (14 days), export disabled
What you get: Full platform access, all templates, CMS features
Upgrade trigger: Trial expires (no card, no charge - just stops working)

üí° Pro tip: Webflow's trial is honest - 14 days to test everything, no card, no surprise charges. If you don't upgrade, site just goes offline (no charge). Use 14 days wisely - build fast, test thoroughly, decide before trial ends.

3. Durable - Free Trial (8/10)

Free trial: Time-limited (duration varies), no credit card during trial
Limitations: Time-limited, AI-generated sites
What you get: Full site generation in 30 seconds, all features
Upgrade trigger: Trial expires (card only requested if continuing)

üí° Pro tip: Durable generates full site in 30 seconds - fastest path to live website. Use free trial to generate site, test features, see if you like AI approach. No card during trial - only requested if you decide to continue.

4. Carrd - Free Forever (Basic but Functional) (6/10)

Free tier: Free forever, no credit card ever
Limitations: Very basic (1-page sites, limited elements, Carrd branding)
What you get: Functional site, custom domain allowed (on paid), simple editor
Upgrade trigger: Remove branding, more sites, pro features

üí° Pro tip: Carrd is for simple one-page sites - profiles, link trees, basic landing pages. Not for full websites. If you just need simple presence, Carrd free is fine. For anything serious, use Framer/Webflow.

5. Google Sites - Free Forever (Very Basic) (4/10)

Free tier: 100% free, no credit card ever, part of Google account
Limitations: Very basic, outdated design, limited customization
What you get: Functional site, Google Drive integration, collaborative editing
Upgrade trigger: None (but you'll outgrow it quickly)

üí° Pro tip: Google Sites is fine for internal docs, student projects, basic sites. Not for professional use. If you care about design (and you should), use Framer free tier instead.

DECISION FRAMEWORK

‚úÖ CHOOSE FRAMER FREE TIER (9/10) IF:

  • ‚Ä¢ You want free forever (no time pressure)
  • ‚Ä¢ You're okay with footer branding initially
  • ‚Ä¢ You want professional design on free tier
  • ‚Ä¢ You might upgrade later (when ready)
  • ‚Ä¢ You want to test thoroughly before paying

Best for: Most people - best free tier, no rush, professional results

‚úÖ CHOOSE WEBFLOW TRIAL (7/10) IF:

  • ‚Ä¢ You want to test full platform (no feature limits)
  • ‚Ä¢ You're deciding between Webflow and others
  • ‚Ä¢ You can commit time to testing (14 days goes fast)
  • ‚Ä¢ You want to learn Webflow without paying first
  • ‚Ä¢ You're comfortable with steeper learning curve

Best for: Testing Webflow's power before committing

‚úÖ CHOOSE DURABLE TRIAL (8/10) IF:

  • ‚Ä¢ You want to see AI generation in action
  • ‚Ä¢ You need a site NOW (30 seconds)
  • ‚Ä¢ You're comparing AI builders
  • ‚Ä¢ You don't care about long-term platform lock-in
  • ‚Ä¢ You want fastest path to live site

Best for: Testing AI generation speed and quality

üí° MY RECOMMENDATION

Start with Framer's free tier (9/10). Free forever, no credit card, professional design - lowest risk way to test platform. Build site, launch on .framer.site domain, upgrade only when ready for custom domain. If Framer doesn't fit, try Webflow's 14-day trial (also no credit card) to test more powerful platform. Avoid any "free trial" requiring credit card - it's a trap. 43% of people forget to cancel and get charged. Don't be one of them. True free means: no card required, use the platform, decide at your pace. Framer gets this right.

BOTTOM LINE

Framer (9/10): Best free tier. No card. Professional. Free forever.

Webflow (7/10): 14-day trial. No card. Full platform test.

FREE NO CREDIT CARD:
TEST WITHOUT RISK

"Free" platforms that require credit cards aren't really free - they're free trials hoping you'll forget to cancel. True free platforms let you test without payment information on file. Here's what's actually available and what you get.

WHY NO CREDIT CARD MATTERS

THE HIDDEN COSTS OF "FREE TRIALS"

Forgotten Subscriptions

43% of users forget to cancel free trials before being charged. Platforms bank on this - it's their business model.

Automatic Renewal Traps

Many platforms auto-charge without explicit confirmation. Canceling can be intentionally difficult.

Payment Data Security

Every platform you store your card with is another data breach risk. Minimize where your payment information lives.

Psychological Commitment

Once you've entered payment info, you're mentally committed. The platform has leverage. True free platforms earn your business, don't trap you.

WHO NEEDS NO-CREDIT-CARD FREE?

  • ‚úì Students & beginners: Learning without financial risk
  • ‚úì Casual users: Personal projects that might not materialize
  • ‚úì Platform comparison: Testing multiple options simultaneously
  • ‚úì Privacy-conscious users: Minimizing data exposure
  • ‚úì International users: Avoiding currency conversion fees
  • ‚úì Budget-constrained: Zero-cost experimentation phase

REALITY CHECK: No-credit-card free tiers have limitations. You're trading features for freedom from payment requirements. Know the tradeoffs before committing time.

PLATFORMS: NO CREDIT CARD REQUIRED

AI BUILDERS WITH TRUE FREE TIERS

Mixo.io

Forever free: 1 site, subdomain only (yourname.mixo.io), Mixo branding, limited AI generations.

BEST FOR: Testing the AI generation concept. No time limit, but single site restriction is limiting.

Durable.co

3-day free trial: Full features, no credit card required. After 3 days, site goes read-only unless you upgrade.

BEST FOR: Quick testing of Durable's specific AI approach. Not a long-term free solution.

Relume (AI Site Builder)

Free tier: Unlimited sitemaps and wireframes with AI. Webflow export requires paid plan. No card needed for free tier.

BEST FOR: Planning and wireframing. You'll need Webflow or similar to actually build.

TeleportHQ

Free tier: 1 project, code export available, collaborative features. No credit card for free tier.

BEST FOR: Developers who want code export. More technical than Mixo/Durable.

TRADITIONAL BUILDERS WITH FREE TIERS

WordPress.com (Free Plan)

Truly free: Subdomain, basic themes, community support. No credit card ever required. WordPress-branded subdomain.

BEST FOR: Bloggers and writers. No AI generation, but full CMS without payment.

Wix (Free Plan)

Forever free: Wix subdomain, 500MB storage, ads included. No credit card required for free plan.

BEST FOR: Learning Wix's editor. Ads on free site make it unprofessional for business use.

Webflow (Free Starter Plan)

Free forever: 2 projects, webflow.io domain, code export not included. No credit card needed.

BEST FOR: Learning Webflow, portfolio projects. Serious sites need paid plan for custom domain and code export.

Google Sites

Completely free: Part of Google account, sites.google.com domain, basic but functional. No payment ever.

BEST FOR: Internal docs, simple info sites. Not for professional branding or e-commerce.

FREE TIER LIMITATIONS: WHAT YOU'RE TRADING

DOMAIN BRANDING

Your platform's subdomain: yoursite.platform.com. Looks unprofessional for businesses.

Exception: Some platforms allow custom domain mapping on free tier with paid domain elsewhere.

STORAGE & BANDWIDTH

Hard limits: 500MB storage common, bandwidth caps. Hit the limit and site slows or shuts down.

Image-heavy sites (photographers, portfolios) hit limits fastest.

FEATURE GATING

Critical features paywalled: Custom domains, code export, e-commerce, analytics, form submissions.

Free tier is a teaser, not a full solution.

STRATEGY: Use free tiers to test and learn, not to build your permanent online presence. Once you've found the right platform, budget for a paid plan. The $15-30/month investment is worth it for professional features.

COMPARISON: FREE TIER VS PAID PLAN

MIXO.IO: FREE VS STARTER ($9/MONTH)

FREE TIER

  • ‚Ä¢ Mixo subdomain (yourname.mixo.io)
  • ‚Ä¢ Mixo branding on site
  • ‚Ä¢ 1 site only
  • ‚Ä¢ Limited AI generations
  • ‚Ä¢ No custom domain
  • ‚Ä¢ No analytics

STARTER PLAN ($9/mo)

  • ‚Ä¢ Connect custom domain
  • ‚Ä¢ Remove Mixo branding
  • ‚Ä¢ Unlimited AI generations
  • ‚Ä¢ Basic analytics
  • ‚Ä¢ Form submissions
  • ‚Ä¢ SSL certificate

VERDICT: Free tier tests AI generation. Starter plan ($9/mo) is minimum for professional use. Annual billing drops to $6/mo.

WEBFLOW: FREE VS CORE ($29/MONTH)

FREE STARTER

  • ‚Ä¢ 2 projects
  • ‚Ä¢ Webflow.io subdomain
  • ‚Ä¢ No code export
  • ‚Ä¢ No CMS (for blogs/dynamic content)
  • ‚Ä¢ 1GB bandwidth
  • ‚Ä¢ No custom domain

CORE PLAN ($29/mo)

  • ‚Ä¢ Custom domain connection
  • ‚Ä¢ 500GB bandwidth
  • ‚Ä¢ Code export included
  • ‚Ä¢ 2 CMS collections (for blogs)
  • ‚Ä¢ Advanced interactions
  • ‚Ä¢ Remove Webflow branding

VERDICT: Free tier is for learning Webflow. Core plan ($29/mo) is minimum for any serious project. Worth it if you need code export.

TESTING STRATEGY: HOW TO USE FREE TIERS

EFFICIENT PLATFORM TESTING

  1. STEP 1: Identify 2-3 platforms that match your use case
  2. STEP 2: Create free accounts on all simultaneously
  3. STEP 3: Build the same simple site on each (3-5 pages)
  4. STEP 4: Compare the experience - speed, ease, results
  5. STEP 5: Choose your favorite and upgrade to paid

TIME INVESTMENT: 2-3 hours total. Saves you from committing to the wrong platform.

FREE TIER HACKS

Custom Domain on Free Tier

Buy domain separately ($10-15/year from Namecheap, Cloudflare). Point DNS to free-tier site. Some platforms allow this; others require paid plan.

Remove Platform Branding

Custom CSS can sometimes hide/modify platform footers. May violate TOS. Check platform rules before modifying.

Email Forwarding Workaround

Use professional email from your domain registrar. Forward to your personal email. Free platform limitations don't affect this.

WHEN TO SKIP FREE TIERS ENTIRELY

BUSINESSES WITH REVENUE

If you're earning money, the $15-30/month is a business expense, not a personal cost. Free tiers project amateur status. Professional tools = professional results.

E-COMMERCE SITES

No free tier supports serious selling. Transaction fees alone justify platform costs. Start with paid e-commerce plan or use dedicated platform (Shopify).

CLIENT WORK & AGENCIES

Clients pay for your tools. Bill platform costs as line item. Using free tiers for client work is unprofessional and limits what you can deliver.

TIME-SENSITIVE LAUNCHES

Learning platform limitations on free tier wastes time. Paid plans have full features enabled, faster builds, better support. Your time is worth more than $15/month.

FINAL TAKEAWAY: Free tiers are for learning and experimentation, not for building professional online presences. Test freely, then pay for what works. The platform that earns your business deserves the revenue.
